result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:32 PM Defendant Scott M Kontney in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Scott M Kontney.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Sheets provides the Court with a written waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
